comment.author: 57122954@N06
comment._content:
Known as bathing boxes, All bathers were obliged to undress in this kind of box.
The box would be pulled by donkey to the waters edge, and when the tide turned
it would be pulled back up to the sea wall.

comment.author: 44911068@N03
comment._content: At last; Kilkee !!!  My fathers family was from a townland  just outside Kilkee called Kilfearagh !!!  But this is where everybody ended up.  I have 7 or 8 first cousins living in Kilkee.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: I think 1880 looks good, The terrace of two storey houses looks new, and very like this house from c. 1880. OS 25" map is identical, from 1896, totally different from the 1840 6".

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Nearby, and slightly later (I'd guess 1893):
